characters: LANDSLIDE CRUMBLES DOWN INTO THE RIVER VALLEY, WATER CRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An asteroid belt.

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: An asteroid bumps another asteroid off course. Its new trajectory: Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF DINOSAURS peacefully eat in a field.

dialogues.speaker: ASTEROID/DINOSAURS
dialogues.text: The asteroid continues descending... The dinosaurs continue chewing, unaware... The asteroid is burning up in Earth’s atmosphere... The dinosaurs are still eating... ZIP! The asteroid misses Earth! A meteor streaks across the night sky. The dinosaurs go b to their business, saved from extinction... FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iconic widescreen “frontier” shots: big skies, majestic clouds, jagged peaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flowing RIVER, next to it a frontier farm. A pit-house and long neatly plowed fields beneath a MOUNT RANGE WITH THREE DISTINCT PEAKS. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 2.

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: A breeze ripples crops. Hay bales next to a fence surrounding the farmland. The ground shakes. Four gigantic dinosaur feet walk by. T camera reveals a massive shadow, and then... an Apatosaur walking across his farm. This is HENRY. BOOM! Henry uses his tail to knock down a tree. He adds i a large pile. He digs his snout into the ground, plows lo furrows into the tough dirt. Alongside Henry is his hardworking Apatosaurus wife, IDA, carrying a yoke of seeds. She scatters them into the fres furrows.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Small sprouts grow in rows across the field. Henry dips his head into the river, gets a mouthful of wa He turns back toward the crops, sprays the water through teeth across the rows.

dialogues.speaker: IDA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Henry! Henry turns toward the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: It’s time! Henry’s face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Ida stand over a nest with THREE EGGS; two are small, but the third one is huge!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Which one did you say moved?

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: The one on the left. A smaller egg starts to rock back and forth. The egg crac open and a big, healthy Apatosaurus, LIBBY, pokes her hea out of the top. A piece of shell rests on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: IDA/HENRY
dialogues.text: Aw. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 3.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: You're a poppa.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You're a momma. The top of the shell falls to the ground. Libby reaches f it, and her egg tips over, falling on top of her. Poppa reaches down, lifts up the egg shell. But Libby’s g

dialogues.speaker: NEWBORN LIBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (squeaky roar) She’s on Momma’s back. She slides down Momma’s neck. Momm quickly grabs her by the tail before she lands on the gro

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: You little sneak. Hello Libby.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Libby. The next small egg moves in the nest. Momma and Poppa wait excitedly. BAM. A leg punches out of the top, stretches around. BAM. BAM. BAM. Three more punch out. The egg darts toward Poppa, crashing into a log post. It crumbles away and another big, healthy Apatosaurus, BUCK, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Hello, Buck. Buck picks up a nearby stick and starts happily bashing a at Poppa’s leg.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: (to Momma) He’s got your eyes. The final, giant egg begins to move. Momma and Poppa wait excitement. And wait. Nothing. Buck appears out of nowhere, starts hitting the egg with stick.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Get out of there, you little prickle bush! ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 4. Poppa chases Buck off the nest. ON THE LARGE EGG: A crack grows around the top...

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Alright, this is gonna be a big one! ON THE EGG: The top falls off... but no one is inside! Worried, Poppa and Momma lean forward to look into the eg tiny Apatosaurus head rises up and peeks, fearful, over t edge of the egg shell.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Hello Arlo. Arlo looks up at his Poppa and Momma, then goes back down inside the shell. Poppa smiles, tips the egg to see tiny Arlo, clinging in to the bottom of the shell.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Come on out. Arlo hesitantly steps out of the shell, like a cat steppi in water. He looks up at his parents: his head is too big his body, his legs so wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: Look at you. Arlo steps forward, but the weight of his oversized head him over onto his nose. Buck appears out of nowhere, starts beating Arlo with his stick.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Buck! Buck runs off, Libby chases after him. Excited by his siblings, Arlo runs to join them, zigzaggi back and forth, trying to get his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck and Libby have stopped in the doorway, but Arlo can’ stop, tumbles past them, rolling out onto the farm. He lo up, sees the THREE GIGANTIC MOUNTAIN PEAKS behind the cab Poppa joins Arlo. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 5.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: That’s Clawtooth Mountain. Poppa gestures to the fields.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: And this is our farm. Libby, Buck, and Momma gather round, looking at the big w outside.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: And we're all gonna take care of it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully grown corn. ON LIBBY: Now 5, watering a corn field. Buck, also now 5, is nearby stacking logs. Libby sees Buck coming toward her, gets an idea. She hide the corn rows. As Buck walks by, Libby spits water at him

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK
dialogues.text: What -- ! Angry, Buck turns around searching for the culprit. Libby pokes her head out.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LIBBY
dialogues.text: Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK
dialogues.text: Libby! Buck reaches into the water well nearby, takes in a mouth Libby goads him by sticking her tongue out, then hides in corn. Buck spits water at her as she runs back and forth throug the rows, taunting him. The whole field is soaked! Libby runs out of the field, and Buck sprays her with the little water he has left.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK
dialogues.text: Got you back! ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 6. Libby calls to Momma who is nearby.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LIBBY
dialogues.text: Momma! I’m done watering!

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: Good job Libby. Buck, get back to your chores! Buck fumes.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LIBBY
dialogues.text: Thanks Buck.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK
dialogues.text: But -- I -- I -- He groans, rolling his head in frustration. Arlo, also now 5, stands next to Momma by the field. She places freshly shucked corn into a BUCKET around his neck

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: You're all set. She gives him a loving nuzzle.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Can't I do somethin’ else, Momma? Momma nudges Arlo with her tail.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: Get goin’.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlo carries the bucket of feed toward the chicken pen. He swallows. It’s ominous. He’s nervous, doesn’t want to in there. He steps in cautiously, begins tossing the corn on the ground. RUSTLE OF BUSHES. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 7.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Who is that? RUSTLE OF BUSHES. Arlo hides behind his bucket. TWEET. TWEET. TWEET. A tiny, adorable, PREHISTORIC CHICK comes out of the grass.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Oh... hey Eustice. Arlo notices a bit of clover tangled on Eustice’s foot.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Oh -- you stuck little guy? Arlo gently nibbles at the weeds.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Let me get that for you. Eustice stays put.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: You're free... Hello, move. Go find your poppa. And your... BOOM. BOOM. Two ugly feet with giant talons step next to Arlo. HENRIETTA -- the chick’s ugly, mean...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: ...momma. Arlo freezes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The gate slams open, Arlo runs, screaming! Henrietta chas Arlo out of the pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppa at the silo, working. Momma, Buck, and Libby nearby Arlo runs past Poppa heading straight toward the river! P stretches out his tail, grabs Arlo, curling him up close.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Whoa! The river is not somethin’ to mess around with there, Arlo. Be careful. What’s the problem? ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 8.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Poppa, Henrietta is the worst one in the coop.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Yesterday you said Footless Fran was the worst.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: She’s only got one foot!

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: You don’t have to like ‘em, Arlo. You just have to feed ‘em. Poppa fills the silo with corn through a small opening. H seals up the hole with a boulder.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: That should do it. He turns to the family.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Now this will keep them rotten critters from stealin’ our food, because I made this silo one hundred percent critter proof.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: Put your mark on there, Henry. You earned it.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK
dialogues.text: Yeah Poppa, do it! Come on.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LIBBY/YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Yeah! Poppa smiles.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Only if your momma does it first. If anyone’s earned a mark ‘round here, it’s her. Momma smiles. She puts her foot into the mud, and marks o of the rocks. Poppa follows, putting his mark up too. The stand back, looking at the marks, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: Did you just put your mark higher than mine? ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 9.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: What? No! It’s just the angle you're looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: The angle, huh? Momma nudges Poppa playfully.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BUCK YOUNG LIBBY
dialogues.text: Ooo -- 000 -- 000 -- me too! Me -- me -- I-I wanna make m I want to put my mark on! mark!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ARLO
dialogues.text: Oh please, I wanna do it! My turn! They all stomp their feet into the mud, run toward the si

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Now hold on, it’s not that easy. He stops them.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: You've gotta earn your mark. By doin’ somethin’ big, for somethin’ bigger than yourself. They consider it.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Someday you’1ll all make your mark, and I can’t wait to see it. ON ARLO: Smiling with determination, looking at Momma and Poppa’s marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck, 10, cracks his neck, getting himself ready. He lean down and pulls up a massive tree! He throws it on a stack huge logs. He has cleared a whole new field. Poppa and Mo stand proudly watching.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: That is how you clear a field. Attaboy Buck. Arlo, 10, runs by screaming, chased by CHICKENS. Poppa chuckles. Momma looks at Poppa concerned. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 10.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: He'll figure it out. Be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck, Momma, and Poppa at the silo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Go on Buck, you earned it. Buck puts his mark up.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: Good job son. Behind them, Arlo looks at the mark, the bucket of corn f around his neck. He sees how proud Momma and Poppa are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Libby, 10, plows in the rain as Momma and Poppa cheer her

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: You got it, Libby! Just a little bit more! Libby finishes, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: You earned your mark sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LIBBY: Making her mark. Momma and Poppa, next to Libby proud. Arlo watches from afar, still with the bucket of corn fee BAWK. Arlo turns, sees the flock of chickens staring at h Arlo screams, running by Momma, Poppa, and Libby -- chase the chickens. He bumps into Buck, who is stacking trees. Buck’s whole pile gets knocked down.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Arlo! Poppa turns to Momma, this time less positive. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 11.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: He’1ll get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ARLO: Looking longingly at the family’s marks on the s The rock next to Poppa’s, waiting for his mark. Arlo’s determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlo marches into frame, the bucket of feed around his ne He’s in “Barney Fife” mode, full of false bravado. Arlo marches across the field, opens the chicken pen gate The chickens stick their heads up out of the bushes, cluc and scratching.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Alright you cluckers, you're about to get fed! He stalks toward the flock.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Arloooo... Arlo sees Buck laying in the grass, hurt. So beat up he c barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Come here...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Buck! What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: I came to help you with your chores. And then they attacked.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You’re gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Tell Momma I love her. I see a light! His eyes close, his head rolls to the side -- he’s dead!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I-I’1ll go get help! ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 12. A shadow slowly rises behind Arlo. Arlo turns and sees a

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Bawwwkkk! BAWK! It attacks Arlo! Arlo screams! Until he realizes -- Buck laughing!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Oh, you should see your face. Arlo whirls around, sees the giant chicken is BUCK’S TAIL DRESSED UP IN DISGUISE.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I should've known! Arlo, furious, whacks the disguise away. He starts poundi Buck in the chest, but Buck is unaffected by the hits.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You always gotta mess me up! Buck has had enough.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Me?! He casually kicks his leg, the force throws Arlo to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: You mess up your chores, and everyone else’s! Arlo struggles to get up. Buck feints going after him, Ar flinches.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: You’re such a coward.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Buck! Momma, Poppa, and Libby come up to the gate.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I ain’t a coward! And I’m gonna make my mark, just like you and Libby and everyone! ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 13.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMA
dialogues.text: You will, darlin’. You just need a little more time. That hurts. Arlo stares at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Forget it. I didn’t even want that dumb mark anyway. Arlo stalks off. Momma looks to Poppa: “We gotta do something.”

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: I got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nighttime farm, peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family asleep in the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Arlo. Arlo. Wake up. Arlo opens his eyes, unsure in the dark. He sees Poppa standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Come with me. Poppa heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s scary out here, NIGHTTIME SOUNDS, dark shadows. Arlo stays close to Poppa. A HOWL goes up! Arlo shudders, looks back, and sees how far they are from cabin. The wilderness beyond the fence surrounding them. can just make out the big Clawtooth Mountain peaks rising the dark.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Where’re we goin’? ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 14.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: You'll see. They come to a field of high grass, pocketed with fog.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Okay, now take a walk out there.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: By myself?

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Go on. Arlo, scared but wanting to impress his father, cautiousl moves out into the grass. An UGLY BUG flies up out of the grass and lands on Arlo’s nose. Arlo looks at it, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Poppa. Poppa. Poppa comes over. Arlo is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Calm down. Breathe. Poppa gently blows on the bug... It glows! Arlo’s eyes go wide in awe... The firefly lifts off Arlo’s nose, flies a into the night. Poppa walks further out into the field. He looks to Arlo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Sometimes you gotta get through your fear to see the beauty on the other side. Poppa swishes his tail in the grass and HUNDREDS OF FIREF fly up into the air!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Wow! Poppa smiles, runs, whooping through the grass, fireflies lifting off all around him, like shimmering stars. Arlo l it, follows. Arlo and Poppa running through the field together, chasin fireflies, making the night dance. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 15. Poppa jumps, BOOM! His big feet landing -- creating a cir of fireflies rippling out into the tall grass and up into starry sky. Poppa’s tail comes around Arlo. And Arlo leans into his Poppa, content, safe. Poppa looks down at Arlo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: I got a new job for you tomorrow. That is, if you still wanna make your mark. Arlo smiles up at his father: he sure does!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppa peers through a hole in the silo, corn at the top l HALF EATEN.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: A dang wilderness critter’s comin’ over the fence, eatin’ our food, and I’ve had it up to my snout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, Poppa kicks the corn on the ground. Arlo stands next to him at the silo, sees the rocks from silo on the ground, the scattered half eaten corn cobs.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: If this keeps up, we won’t have enough food to survive the winter. Arlo understands the seriousness of this.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: That’s why YOU are gonna catch that critter. ON ARLO: Me?! Excited! We now watch as Arlo and Poppa build a trap near the silo Arlo pulls a piece of rope around a tree stump. Poppa pulls one end of rope, Arlo pulls the other. They t rocks to the middle, creating a NET. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 16. Arlo sets the trap, pulling the net high into the tree as Poppa sets bait under the net -- a pile of corn. Poppa pl the trap’s trigger, a stick, in the bait.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Then, along comes a critter... Poppa rolls a pumpkin onto the pile of corn, hitting the trigger. The rope snaps, the net falls down to the ground BUNDLE OF BRANCHES rattles loudly signifying the trap is Poppa picks up a HUGE STICK.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: And this is how you’re gonna finish the job. He brings the stick down fast, smashing the pumpkin. ON ARLO: Gulp! Poppa sets the stick next to the silo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: When that critter’s takin’ care of, you'll put your mark on the silo, right next to mine. Arlo looks up, his eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I'll take care of the critter, Poppa. It won't stand a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlo marches in front of the silo, guarding it. He carrie the giant stick Poppa left. A BEETLE flies by and Arlo darts for it.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: What’re you doing, you bug?! Get outta here... Arlo chases it off. A leaf falls nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Move along leaf! Move along! The leaf floats off. Arlo is pleased with himself but the ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 17. THE RATTLE OF THE TRAP SOUNDS. ON ARLO: He freezes, turns slowly toward the trap. Scary THRASHING SOUNDS come from the trap. Arlo prepares himself with his big stick, goes to investigate. The horrible thrashing sounds grow louder with each step takes... getting closer... closer... He lifts his head over the tall grass and finds an animal struggling in the trap. The critter is pissed off, scream and fighting the trap. Suddenly, the critter turns toward Arlo! Arlo ducks back down, hiding in the brush. Beat. The critter bites at the trap, pushing toward Arlo. Scare Arlo moves back toward the silo. But then Arlo swallows, gets determined. This is his job! He raises the stick over his head preparing for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Y-Y-You’re dead critter. Arlo notices the ropes are biting into the critter, hurti it. It is choking and close to death. The critter looks up -- its gaze is penetrating -- connec with Arlo. Arlo can’t do it, he lowers the branch. Arlo moves to the side -- still well away from the critte and springs the trap. The ropes fall from the critter, an now see it’s a HUMAN BOY. The boy, shocked, looks at the loosened ropes around his feet. THUNDER in the distance, a storm is approaching.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Okay... you’re free. The boy/critter sniffs toward Arlo.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: W-W-What are you doing? Jus-just leave! Flee! ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 18. But the boy/critter keeps coming. Arlo backs away.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Stay back. Go! BAM. Arlo trips over a rock. The boy/critter is almost on him! It’s too much, Arlo is terrified. He screams! Arlo’s yell startles the boy/critter, it takes off into t high grass, running on all fours.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Poppa rushes up, sees the critter take off into the wilderness. Poppa can’t believe it!

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Why’d you let it go?!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: It was was bitin’, and comin' at me and screechin’... and I --

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: You had a job to do! ON ARLO: He knows he failed. Poppa is angry! We’ve never seen him like this, he’s inte intimidating.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: You gotta get over your fear, Arlo, or you won't survive out here! Poppa makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Come on. Poppa marches Arlo across the farm, following the CRITTER TRACKS. He uses his tail to push Arlo forward.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: We’re gonna finish your job right now. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to the fence, Arlo hesitates looking out at the scary wilderness. It’s starting to rain.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Out there? Poppa turns.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Get over. Poppa uses his tail to help Arlo over the fence. The rain picks up in earnest. Poppa and Arlo move out into the wilderness, toward the mountain pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlo looks back at the farm as it vanishes in the distanc The wind is getting strong. Arlo looks up. Storm clouds s above. He stays very close to Poppa, trying to be tough.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: But Poppa, what if we get lost? Poppa stays intent on his tracking, still frustrated with Arlo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: As long as you can find the river, you can find your way home. Poppa pushes Arlo further along.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: What do you see? Arlo is confused, afraid...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Uh, uh t-t-tracks?

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: And they’re washin’ out, we gotta move. Poppa is rushing, Arlo tries to keep up. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 20.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: We're losin’ it! Poppa pushes harder, running to keep the tracks in sight. Arlo tries to keep up, but is falling behind.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Arlo, keep movin’! BOOM. CRASH. A storm cell circles above them. CRASH. Lightning flashes. Arlo flinches and trips over a boulder. He tumbles to the ground, hurting his leg.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Arlo what did I say about keep -- Poppa turns back, sees Arlo struggling, limping. Poppa realizes he’s gone too far. He stops. Goes to Arlo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: It’s -- it’s okay. It’s okay Arlo. I'm s -- I’m sorry. I just wanted you to... get through your fear. I know you have it in you.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: You’re me and more. Arlo looks up to Poppa. CRACK. BOOM. THUNDER rolls over their heads, so close. Ar flinches. Poppa looks up at the storm, turns to Arlo.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: I think we went far enough today. He lifts Arlo out of the mud.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Storm’s gettin’ worse, let’s get you home. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 21. They start to head back, Arlo still limping. The GROUND STARTS TO SHAKE. Poppa looks up, alarmed. The RIVER IS RISING. Now Poppa is all urgency.

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Arlo, MOVE. He pushes Arlo up the hill, away from the river. Arlo’s f slip on the wet rocks as Poppa pushes him. CRASH. Poppa looks upriver. Something huge is barreling toward them, trees are falling!

dialogues.speaker: POPPA
dialogues.text: Run Arlo! There is a ROAR. Arlo looks ahead through the trees and sees, like a horri monster, FLOOD WATER BANKING DOWN THE NARROW CANYON, ROAR TOWARD THEM. Arlo freezes, too terrified to move. Poppa grabs Arlo, th him up the bank. Arlo lands hard, looks back to his fathe

They are all out working hard, harvesting. Buck and Libby work a few rows away from Arlo and Momma. Momma has a huge load of corn on her back. Clearly tired, starts to walk, stumbles to the ground. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 22.

He throws the cob into the si Arlo reaches for another stalk... A corn cob flies out of the silo -- HALF EATEN. A second eaten corn cob flies out. Arlo is shocked.

Trying to get the critter off, Arlo twirls in circles, suddenly falling backward -- SPLASH: INTO THE RIVER!

dialogues.text: But he's already too far away, the current pulling him do the river. Arlo struggles to keep afloat. The rapids pull him under, spins in circles, resurfaces. He hits his head, almost knocked out. ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 24. Arlo resurfaces, his vision fading. The last thing he see are the looming jagged peaks of Clawtooth Mountain. Arlo passes out. FADE TO BLACK.

His feet and legs are scratched and bleeding. He feels a bruise on his head. Grimaces in pain. He looks up, around the sandbar, trying to get his bearin He’s surrounded by cliff walls.

He la on the ground a moment, bruised and battered, catching hi breath. A HOWL goes up. Startled, Arlo looks up and sees a figure at the top of t cliff. It’s the same critter/boy from the farm! The boy l down at Arlo, in what seems like curiosity. Arlo isn’t curious -- he’s pissed!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You! Furious, Arlo propels himself up the cliff to get at the

The boy just sits at the edge of the cliff, watching, as ineptly gets up the cliff. Arlo lifts his head up over the ledge. He uses his neck t inch forward toward the boy.

Arlo’s had it! He rolls himself up the ledge r to fight! But the boy is gone. Human hand and foot prints lead into the wilderness.

dialogues.text: Where am I? Arlo turns in circles, his panic growing. On all sides, j more wilderness.

Arlo steps on berries scattered on the ground. He tastes the squashed fruit off his foot... it’s pretty goo His stomach GROWLS. Arlo looks up the hillside, a BERRY T

What is out there? ©2015 DISNEY*PIXAR - PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL  THE GOOD DINOSAUR - Academy Screenplay - 10/26/2015 27. It CRIES OUT again. Arlo is not safe out here. WILDERNESS CRITTERS scurry across the ground. The drizzle turns into rain. Arlo’s footprints become puddles. THUNDERCLAP. Arlo collects sticks to build a makeshift shelter. Arlo tries positioning larger branches, and has more succ He sits inside his shelter, proud, smiling at the critter under the rock. The critter keeps staring. Arlo sticks hi tongue out at it. DRIP. DRIP. SPLASH. A puddle pours down onto Arlo’s face. The critter squeaks, as if laughing at Arlo. It goes away comes back with TWO OTHER CRITTERS (implying “let’s watch this”). They all squeak, staring at Arlo. Arlo groans, frustrated.

Nearby shrubs RUSTLE, Arlo sits up -- something is coming toward him! Arlo looks out into the wilderness -- whatever it is, it’ getting closer. The bushes in front of Arlo move and there is the boy. He carries a stunned LIZARD in his mouth.

Then steps ba “Okay now eat it.” Repulsed, Arlo takes a branch, brushes the bug’s body and head to the side. The boy barks at Arlo, runs off again.

Rocks crumble beneath tumbling to the ground far below. The boy stops. The ledge ends, with a huge gap to the oth side. The boy thinks a moment.

He’s stretched out across the gap, the tip of his tail holding the other sid The boy scampers across him -- he’s made Arlo into a brid The boy climbs over Arlo’s face, stepping on his eyes.

He drops his tail and propels himself up the opposing ledge. He runs toward the berry bush. The boy starts to growl. Arlo walks past him, but the boy jumps between Arlo and the berries, growling fiercely.

The two have a vicious fight, but the boy is tough, break free from the snake’s coil and head-butts the beast... it squirms away into the nearby brush. Arlo runs next to the boy for safety. The boy shifts from attack mode to happy canine, looking up at Arlo. Arlo smi back but then...

dialogues.text: Cause it's terrifying out here. He can protect me, like my friends. He points to a small SLUG-LIKE CREATURE, resting on his h

dialogues.text: This is Dreamcrusher... he protects me from having unrealistic goals. He points to the pretty, red bird.

dialogues.text: Mmmm... Funeral Planner!... mmm...

dialogues.text: M-M-M-Maniac!

dialogues.text: Violet!

dialogues.text: Lunatic!

dialogues.text: On your path to Clawtooth Mountain, that creature will keep you safe. Don’t ever lose him. Arlo notes that. The Pet Collector's bird starts tweeting, she’s very upse desperate. She’s going nuts.

They rain down on Arl and the boy, who is utterly delighted. The gophers all turn and look at Arlo, angry. They come a him en mass, crawling up his legs! Arlo stumbles backward, slipping into a small lake!

What is in this fruit? The can’t stop laughing! They leap into the air in a shared, happy hallucination. FADE TO WHITE.
